data: The archaeological collection is housed in one long room that has been subdivided into 4 discrete areas containing 25 cases and a series of open displays. 1 case contains pre- and proto-historic material, 3 are for material from Selinunte, 1 Camarina, 8 Erice, 1 Mozia, 1 Birgi, 1 Lilybaeum, 1 Centuripe, 4 contain material of unknown origin, 1 mixed sites, and then 1 for Punic stamped amphora handles, 1 for Greek and Roman stamped amphora handles, and 1 for Latin epigraphy. In addition there are open displays of material found on the seabed (amphorae, anchor parts, a Roman ram from the Aegadi Islands battle), a large two-sided Latin inscription and a section on Arabic and later Jewish inscriptions
Two widely separated lines of monumental letters, possibly with guidelines.

1[---].GNA.[---]
2[---].NA·L·M[---]
Fragment of a dedication to Venus Erycina

The text is arranged over nine lines. The first two lines (praescriptio), larger than the others, are placed across the top. Two columns follow (b and c), the first one consisting of two lines (and a vacat) and the second one of seven. Lines 1-2 of the left column form a separate text from lines 1-2 in the right column. The space between the columns is 2.4 cm.
Photo C. Vacanti with the collaboration and permission of the Museo Regionale di Trapani Agostino Pepoli
